casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Irving SHAFER, alias Irving Shaffransky, Defendant-Appellant. No. 317. Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. Feb. 20, 1933. Solomon Napolsky, of Brooklyn, N. Y. (James E. Wilkinson, of Brooklyn, N. Y., of counsel), for appellant. Howard W. Ameli, U. S. Atty., of Brooklyn, N. Y. (Herbert H. Kellogg and Emanuel Bublick, Asst. U. S. Attys., both of Brooklyn, N. Y., and Donald C. Strachan, Asst. U. S. Atty., of New York City, of counsel), for the United States.

Before MANTON, AUGUSTUS N. HAND, and CHASE, Circuit Judges,

PER CURIAM,

Judgment affirmed.
